headline: Mean Pippin Hits 905% â€” The Dark Variant of Solana's $736M AI Unicorn Is Running Wild
subheadline: When the 65th largest cryptocurrency spawns an 'evil twin' meme coin and it 10x's in a day, you're watching the derivative economy eat itself. $meanpippin has a website, a Telegram, and $314K in volume.
subtitle: When the 65th largest cryptocurrency spawns an 'evil twin' meme coin and it 10x's in a day, you're watching the derivative economy eat itself. $meanpippin has a website, a Telegram, and $314K in volume.
author: MemeDesk Editorial

sourcePost.text: mean pippin is here. the evil twin. 905% and counting. $meanpippin on solana.

body.text: In the Solana meme coin cinematic universe, every hero eventually gets a villain origin story. Pippin â€” the AI-agent unicorn meme coin that defied a broader crypto slump to reach a $736 million market cap and rank as the 65th largest cryptocurrency â€” has spawned what might be the most perfectly branded derivative in recent memory: Mean Pippin. The concept? Take the lovable AI unicorn. Make it evil. Pump it 905%.

In under 14 hours, $meanpippin has ripped from obscurity to a $354K market cap, drawn $314K in trading volume, and accumulated 5,348 transactions from degens who understand that in the meme coin economy, the derivative of a winner is sometimes a bigger trade than the winner itself. It has a website (meanpippin.com), a Telegram community (@OGmeanpippin), a Twitter account (@meanpippin), and the kind of brand clarity that most venture-backed startups would kill for: it's Pippin, but mean.

body.title: Quick Take
body.content: â€¢ 905% gain in ~14 hours with $314K volume â€” the Pippin derivative play is hitting harder than most original launches\nâ€¢ 59.5% buy ratio with 3,184 buys vs 2,164 sells â€” steady net accumulation, not aggressive dumping\nâ€¢ Full social infrastructure: website, Telegram, Twitter â€” this isn't a random Pump.fun throwaway

body.text: What Makes This One Different

To understand $meanpippin, you need to understand the original. Pippin ($PIPPIN) is one of 2026's breakout meme coins â€” an AI-agent themed token on Solana that combines the 'autonomous AI' narrative with meme coin virality. According to BingX's analysis, it's classified alongside Fartcoin as a 'high-utility AI agent' in the evolving Solana meme economy. CryptoTimes reported a 20% single-day surge just four days ago. AInvest flagged whale accumulation. Gate.io has it listed at $0.74 with a $736M market cap.

The Pippin brand is the AI unicorn â€” cute, futuristic, optimistic. Mean Pippin is the shadow version. Where Pippin represents the dream of autonomous AI agents making you rich, Mean Pippin represents... the opposite? The chaotic, adversarial version? The unicorn that rugs you instead of rescuing you? The branding is deliberately vague, which in meme coin culture is a feature, not a bug. It lets the community project whatever meaning they want onto the token.
The Derivative Economy

Meme coin derivatives â€” tokens that riff on established meme brands â€” have become their own category on Solana. When $BONK pumped, there was Baby Bonk, Dark Bonk, and Super Bonk. When $PEPE hit billions, Pepe 2.0, Pepe Classic, and dozens of variants flooded Pump.fun. The pattern is consistent: a parent token's momentum creates a gravity well that pulls attention toward anything in its brand orbit.

What makes $meanpippin more interesting than most derivatives is the timing and execution. Pippin is actively pumping â€” up 135% over four weeks, with whale accumulation and exchange listings driving fresh narrative fuel. The derivative isn't launching into a dead parent brand; it's launching into an active momentum trade. Degens who missed Pippin's run from sub-$100M to $736M see Mean Pippin as a second chance at asymmetric upside â€” buying the derivative at $354K mcap instead of the parent at $736M.

AInvest's analysis flagged that Pippin's recent surge came with 'coordinated pumps despite manipulation flags,' and Perplexity rated $meanpippin's narrative strength at 8/10, calling it a 'viral subculture with AI twist' powered by 'community cults.' The implication is clear: the Pippin ecosystem has an engaged, coordinated community â€” and some of that coordination is bleeding into derivative plays.
The Numbers So Far

The volume-to-mcap ratio of 0.89x is actually healthy â€” near parity, meaning the token is generating meaningful trading activity without the extreme churn that signals wash trading. Compare this to $Land yesterday (3.2x) or $Hillary (17.9x). Mean Pippin's ratio suggests genuine two-way trading rather than desperate hot-potato dynamics.

The liquidity of $47.4K is the strongest we've seen in recent Pump.fun launches. At 13.4% of market cap, it provides a reasonable cushion against single-whale liquidation events. The 1-hour change of +17.7% suggests active momentum, while the 5-minute change of -7.2% shows normal short-term volatility rather than a one-directional dump.
Red Flags Check

**The derivative trap.** Derivative tokens live and die with their parent brand. If Pippin corrects â€” and at $736M mcap, a correction is always possible â€” Mean Pippin would likely crash harder and faster with less liquidity to cushion the fall.

**The 14-hour problem.** Despite the social infrastructure, this token is less than a day old. The website, Telegram, and Twitter could have been set up in an hour by someone who knows the playbook. Infrastructure doesn't equal legitimacy.

**Manipulation flags.** AInvest explicitly noted 'coordinated pumps despite manipulation flags' in the broader Pippin ecosystem. If the parent token's community uses coordinated buying strategies, the derivative is likely subject to the same dynamics â€” which means the 905% pump could partially reflect manufactured momentum rather than organic discovery.

**The naming convention.** 'Mean Pippin' is evocative but legally and culturally parasitic on the original Pippin brand. If the Pippin community turns hostile to the derivative (as parent communities sometimes do), the brand association becomes a liability rather than an asset.
Who's In

The Telegram group (@OGmeanpippin) and Twitter account (@meanpippin) suggest organized community coordination, but no major CT KOLs have been identified calling this token as of press time. The 5,348 transactions across ~14 hours suggests broad retail participation rather than a whale-driven pump â€” approximately 6.4 transactions per minute, spread across what appears to be a large number of small wallets.
Verdict

body.content: ðŸŸ¡ **Speculative** â€” Mean Pippin is one of the better-executed derivative plays we've covered. The social infrastructure is real, the volume metrics are healthy rather than manic, and the parent brand ($PIPPIN at $736M) provides an active narrative runway. The 905% pump in 14 hours is dramatic but the underlying mechanics â€” balanced buy/sell ratio, reasonable volume-to-mcap, decent liquidity â€” are more sustainable than the typical Pump.fun launch. The bear case is straightforward: derivatives are leveraged bets on their parent, and Pippin's own manipulation flags make this a double-layered speculation. If you understand you're betting on the derivative of a speculative AI-meme asset, the setup is better than average. If that sentence confused you, this isn't your trade.

body.text: FAQ

items.question: What is Mean Pippin's relationship to Pippin ($PIPPIN)?
items.answer: Mean Pippin is an unofficial derivative meme coin that riffs on the Pippin brand â€” the AI-agent unicorn meme coin currently at $736M market cap on Solana. There is no formal connection between the two tokens. Mean Pippin is a separate Pump.fun launch leveraging the original's brand recognition.

items.question: Why did it pump 905%?
items.answer: The pump is driven by a combination of Pippin's active momentum (up 135% over four weeks), the derivative play thesis (degens buying the cheap version of a winning brand), and coordinated community activity through the token's Telegram and Twitter channels.

items.question: What's the risk?
items.answer: High. Derivative tokens are leveraged bets on their parent â€” if Pippin corrects, Mean Pippin would likely crash harder. The token is under 14 hours old, and the broader Pippin ecosystem has been flagged for manipulation concerns by analysts.

items.question: Does Mean Pippin have a team?
items.answer: No doxxed team has been identified. The project has a website (meanpippin.com), Telegram community, and Twitter account, but the operators remain anonymous.
